findings.description: JitPack content filter includes com.walletconnect.* group which overlaps with Maven Central. WalletConnect main artifacts (android-core, sign) are on Maven Central. The JitPack filter should only catch transitive dependencies (com.walletconnect.Scarlet.*). Current filter works but causes redundant lookups.
findings.recommendation: Narrow JitPack filter to com\.walletconnect\.Scarlet\..* instead of com\.walletconnect\..*. Low priority — only affects build resolution speed, not correctness.

findings.description: White-label app name uses fallback: project.findProperty("APP_NAME")?.toString() ?: "MCW Wallet". This is acceptable for UI fallback per project rules (No Fallback Policy exception for UI).
findings.recommendation: No action needed. Documented for traceability.

findings.description: The gradlew script is a manually written approximation of the standard Gradle wrapper script. It lacks DEFAULT_JVM_OPTS, GRADLE_OPTS handling, and proper argument quoting. This may cause issues with custom JVM args or Gradle opts.
findings.recommendation: Consider regenerating via 'gradle wrapper' command in CI or replacing with the canonical gradlew from a Gradle 8.5 distribution. Low priority — the script works for basic builds.

findings.description: WalletConnect sign version changed from spec 2.28.0 to 2.31.0 because 2.28.0 does not exist on Maven Central. This deviation is documented in the commit message.
findings.recommendation: No action needed. Deviation properly documented.

summary: Android project scaffold is well-structured. 9 modules properly defined with appropriate dependency separation. BouncyCastle resolution strategy is correct. Two low-severity findings, no blockers.
